org.ireas.mediawiki.exceptions

Class HttpMediaWikiException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • org.ireas.mediawiki.exceptions.MediaWikiException
          • org.ireas.mediawiki.exceptions.HttpMediaWikiException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public final class HttpMediaWikiException
extends MediaWikiException
    Thrown if an HTTP error occurs during an API request. The exception provides the status code of the HTTP error (getStatusCode).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HttpMediaWikiException(int statusCode, String reason)
      Constructs a new exception caused by an HTTP error with the specified status code and the specified reason.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Returns the status code of the HTTP error that caused this exception to be thrown.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpMediaWikiException

        public HttpMediaWikiException(int statusCode,
                      String reason)
        Constructs a new exception caused by an HTTP error with the specified status code and the specified reason.
        Parameters:
        statusCode - the status code of the HTTP error that caused this exception to be thrown
        reason - the reason phrase of the HTTP error that caused this exception to be thrown
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified reason phrase is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified status code is less than 100 or higher than 999

    • Method Detail

      • newInstance

        public static HttpMediaWikiException newInstance(StatusLine statusLine)
        Constructs a new exception from the specified status line.
        Parameters:
        statusLine - the status line with information about the error that caused this exception to be thrown
        Returns:
        a new exception for the error represented by the specified status line
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified status line or its reason phrase is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the status code of the specified status line is less than 100 or higher than 999

      • getStatusCode

        public int getStatusCode()
        Returns the status code of the HTTP error that caused this exception to be thrown.
        Returns:
        the error code for this exception
